Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. Still... all that aside one needs to appreciate what this little independent gem accomplished.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie centers around Miyazawa’s life beginning at age 9 and carries forward to his death during World War II at age 38. It’s fast paced, driven by the poetic quality of Kenji’s writing as dramatized on screen, with little business slowing things down.

Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form an alliance against the cat, which rises up to protest its treatment.
